calls.summary: Partner expressed concerns about rate parity with OTA competitors. Discussed VB program benefits and showed ROI calculator, but partner wants to see concrete numbers from similar properties before committing. Follow-up scheduled for next week with case studies.
keyQuotes: We need to see concrete numbers before we invest more in visibility.
Our competitors on Booking.com seem to get better placement.
The VB concept makes sense, but prove it works for boutique hotels.

objections.notes: Partner wants case studies from similar-sized properties
Explained rate parity tools and monitoring dashboard

actionItems: Send VB case studies for boutique hotels in EMEA
calls.coachingInsight: Consider leading with success metrics earlier in the call. Partner engagement increased significantly when specific numbers were mentioned.

draftEmail.subject: Follow-up: VB Program Discussion & Case Studies
draftEmail.body:
Hi [Partner Name],

Thank you for your time today discussing how Visibility Boosters can help Sunset Beach Resort compete more effectively.

As promised, I'm attaching:
• VB case studies from similar boutique hotels in EMEA
• Custom ROI projection for your property

I'd love to walk you through these numbers on our follow-up call scheduled for January 20th.

Best regards,
Ben

calls.summary: Partner frustrated about recent spike in cancellations (up 15% in December). Attributed to unclear policies displayed to guests. Also raised concerns about slow support response times. Escalated support ticket and provided direct contact for urgent issues.
keyQuotes: We've lost thousands in revenue from these cancellations.
I've been waiting 5 days for a response on my support ticket.
If this doesn't improve, we'll have to reconsider our partnership.

objections.notes: Logged bug report with product team - ETA 2 weeks

actionItems: Follow up on bug fix status by Jan 15
Check on partner satisfaction in 1 week
Review cancellation trends for similar properties
calls.coachingInsight: Acknowledge frustration more explicitly before moving to solutions. Sentiment improved when partner felt heard.

draftEmail.subject: Action Taken: Your Support Ticket & Cancellation Concerns
draftEmail.body:
Hi [Partner Name],

I wanted to follow up immediately on our conversation today. I understand how frustrating the cancellation spike and support delays have been.

Here's what I've done:
• Escalated your support ticket with high priority - you'll hear back within 24 hours
• Logged the cancellation policy display issue with our product team (ETA: 2 weeks)
• Set up direct contact for any urgent issues

I'll personally check in again on January 15th to ensure we're making progress.

Best regards,
Ben

nextSteps: Follow up on bug fix by Jan 15

calls.summary: Successful VB enrollment call. Partner excited about upcoming spring season and wants to maximize visibility. Enrolled in Premium VB package for March-May. Also discussed Members-Only deals program - partner will review internally and confirm by end of week.
keyQuotes: This is exactly what we need for the spring rush.
The ROI numbers from last year's participants are impressive.
Let's do the premium package - we want to be aggressive this year.
actionItems: Follow up on Members-Only decision by Jan 17
calls.coachingInsight: Excellent use of seasonal timing in positioning. Reference this approach for other spring-focused properties.

draftEmail.subject: Welcome to VB Premium! Your Spring Success Package
draftEmail.body:
Hi [Partner Name],

Great conversation today! I'm excited about your commitment to growth this spring.

Confirming your VB Premium enrollment:
• Active period: March 1 - May 31
• Expected visibility lift: 35-45%
• Investment: As discussed

I'll also follow up on January 17th regarding the Members-Only deals program.

Attached: Your VB calendar and spring marketing resources.

Here's to a successful spring season!

Best regards,
Ben

nextSteps: Follow up on Members-Only by Jan 17

calls.summary: Review focused on content optimization. Partner's listing has outdated photos (3+ years old). Discussed content refresh program and photo shoot subsidies. Partner hesitant about cost but acknowledged photos need updating. Sent competitor comparison showing impact of fresh content.
keyQuotes: I know the photos are old, but a professional shoot is expensive.
What kind of ROI can I expect from new photos?
Our competitors do look more modern in search results.

objections.notes: Sent info about content refresh subsidy program

actionItems: Provide ROI data on photo updates
calls.coachingInsight: Good job surfacing competitive angle. Partner was more receptive when seeing side-by-side comparison.

calls.summary: Comprehensive strategy session for 2025. Partner committed to 15% growth target. Agreed on multi-pronged approach: XLR program enrollment, dynamic pricing implementation, and Q2 VB campaign. Partner very engaged - took notes throughout and asked detailed questions.
keyQuotes: We're all-in on growth this year.
The XLR program sounds like exactly what we need.
Let's build out the full calendar - I want to plan ahead.
calls.coachingInsight: Excellent strategic conversation. The prepared 2025 planning framework resonated strongly - recommend using with other growth-focused partners.

calls.summary: Brief check-in call. Partner satisfied with December performance (+12% YoY bookings). No major issues raised. Confirmed interest in upcoming rate optimization webinar. Quick, efficient call.
keyQuotes: December was great for us - best in three years.
Keep up the good work!
Sign me up for that webinar.
actionItems: Register partner for rate optimization webinar
calls.coachingInsight: Good relationship maintenance. Short check-ins like this help sustain positive partnerships.

calls.summary: Partner experiencing channel manager integration issues for the past 2 weeks. Bookings not syncing properly, causing overbooking incidents. Very frustrated. Escalated to technical team with high priority. Offered temporary manual support until resolved.
keyQuotes: We've had three overbookings this week alone.
This is damaging our reputation with guests.
I need this fixed immediately or we'll have to pause our listing.
actionItems: Coordinate with tech team on fix timeline
calls.coachingInsight: Consider acknowledging the business impact more explicitly. Partner de-escalated when the severity was fully recognized.

calls.summary: Mixed review. Bookings stable but partner feels pricing is too aggressive in their market. Discussed competitor analysis and rate positioning. Partner will test a 5% rate increase for February as a trial. Also suggested content refresh for 2 properties.
keyQuotes: I think we're leaving money on the table with these rates.
Let's try a small increase and see what happens.
The market here is getting more competitive every month.
calls.coachingInsight: Good job finding middle ground on pricing disagreement. The test approach gave partner control while maintaining relationship.
